enrichment.summary: This executive order reverses previous efforts to weaken federal civil service protections by eliminating the controversial Schedule F classification, supports and encourages union organizing and collective bargaining for federal workers, and directs steps toward ensuring a living wage for federal employees. It aims to strengthen and empower the career federal workforce as a model employer.
potential_concerns: Revoking Schedule F and related orders could face resistance from agencies favoring more flexible hiring and removal processes.
Encouraging collective bargaining and union organizing might increase federal labor costs and administrative complexity.
Implementing a $15/hour minimum wage for federal employees could raise budgetary pressures and require additional appropriations.
Suspending or rescinding existing discipline and removal reforms could slow agency responsiveness and impact accountability measures.
Agencies may struggle to uniformly revise or rescind policies tied to the revoked executive orders, causing inconsistent implementation.
